M0.description: Master 0 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M1.description: Master 1 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M2.description: Master 2 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M3.description: Master 3 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M4.description: Master 4 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M5.description: Master 5 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

M6.description: Master 6 Priority. Sets the arbitration priority for this port on the associated slave port.

EARS.description: Enable Asynchronous Request in Stop Register

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLNO.description: TCD Minor Byte Count (Minor Loop Mapping Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFNO.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping Enabled and Offset Disabled)

TCD%s_NBYTES_MLOFFYES.description: TCD Signed Minor Loop Offset (Minor Loop Mapping and Offset Enabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_CITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Current Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

TCD%s_DLASTSGA.description: TCD Last Destination Address Adjustment/Scatter Gather Address

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKNO.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Disabled)

TCD%s_BITER_ELINKYES.description: TCD Beginning Minor Loop Link, Major Loop Count (Channel Linking Enabled)

ERRCHN.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

VLD.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

SAST.description: Set All START Bits (activates all channels)

EDREQ_0.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 0.

EDREQ_1.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 1.

EDREQ_2.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 2.

EDREQ_3.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 3.

EDREQ_4.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 4

EDREQ_5.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 5

EDREQ_6.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 6

EDREQ_7.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 7

EDREQ_8.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 8

EDREQ_9.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 9

EDREQ_10.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 10

EDREQ_11.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 11

EDREQ_12.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 12

EDREQ_13.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 13

EDREQ_14.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 14

EDREQ_15.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 15

EDREQ_16.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 16

EDREQ_17.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 17

EDREQ_18.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 18

EDREQ_19.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 19

EDREQ_20.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 20

EDREQ_21.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 21

EDREQ_22.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 22

EDREQ_23.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 23

EDREQ_24.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 24

EDREQ_25.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 25

EDREQ_26.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 26

EDREQ_27.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 27

EDREQ_28.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 28

EDREQ_29.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 29

EDREQ_30.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 30

EDREQ_31.description: Enable asynchronous DMA request in stop mode for channel 31

MLOFF.description: If SMLOE or DMLOE is set, this field represents a sign-extended offset applied to the source or destination address to form the next-state value after the minor loop completes.

ELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete
Enable channel-to-channel linking on minor-loop complete

DLASTSGA.description: Destination last address adjustment or the memory address for the next transfer control descriptor to be loaded into this channel (scatter/gather)

INTMAJOR.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

INTHALF.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

MAJORELINK.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

ELINK.description: Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete
Enables channel-to-channel linking on minor loop complete

CSPMCR.description: Chip Select port Multiplexing Control Register

EXTS.description: Extended Transfer Start/Extended Address Latch Enable Controls how long FB_TS /FB_ALE is asserted.

EAR%s.description: Error Address Register, slave port n

EDR%s.description: Error Detail Register, slave port n

RGDAAC%s.description: Region Descriptor Alternate Access Control n

M0UM.description: Bus Master 0 User Mode Access Control

M0SM.description: Bus Master 0 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M1UM.description: Bus Master 1 User Mode Access Control

M1SM.description: Bus Master 1 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M2UM.description: Bus Master 2 User Mode Access control

M2SM.description: Bus Master 2 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M3UM.description: Bus Master 3 User Mode Access Control

M3SM.description: Bus Master 3 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M0UM.description: Bus Master 0 User Mode Access Control

M0SM.description: Bus Master 0 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M1UM.description: Bus Master 1 User Mode Access Control

M1SM.description: Bus Master 1 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M2UM.description: Bus Master 2 User Mode Access Control

M2SM.description: Bus Master 2 Supervisor Mode Access Control

M3UM.description: Bus Master 3 User Mode Access Control

M3SM.description: Bus Master 3 Supervisor Mode Access Control

MGSTAT0.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

EEERDY.description: For devices with FlexNVM: This flag indicates if the EEPROM backup data has been copied to the FlexRAM and is therefore available for read access

CCOBn.description: The FCCOB register provides a command code and relevant parameters to the memory controller

MAXMB.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

IRMQ.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

IDLE.description: This bit indicates when CAN bus is in IDLE state

BUF5I.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

BUF6I.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Warning"

BUF7I.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

EACEN.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

WRMFRZ.description: Write-Access To Memory In Freeze Mode

TIME_STAMP.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

DLC.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

RTR.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

IDE.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

SRR.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

EXT.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

STD.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

PRIO.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

CTAR%s.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Master Mode)

CTAR_SLAVE.description: Clock and Transfer Attributes Register (In Slave Mode)

RSER.description: DMA/Interrupt Request Select and Enable Register

PUSHR.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Master Mode

PUSHR_SLAVE.description: PUSH TX FIFO Register In Slave Mode

PCSIS0.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

PCSIS1.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

PCSIS2.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

PCSIS3.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

PCSIS4.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

PCSIS5.description: Peripheral Chip Select x Inactive State

RFDF_DIRS.description: Receive FIFO Drain DMA or Interrupt Request Select

TFFF_DIRS.description: Transmit FIFO Fill DMA or Interrupt Request Select

PCS0.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

PCS1.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

PCS2.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

PCS3.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

PCS4.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

PCS5.description: Select which PCS signals are to be asserted for the transfer

DATAL.description: DATAL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATALL.description: CRCLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit DATA

DATALU.description: DATALL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAH.description: DATAH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

DATAHL.description: DATAHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

DATAHU.description: DATAHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYL.description: POLYL stores the lower 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYLL.description: POLYLL stores the first 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYLU.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYH.description: POLYH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC polynomial value

GPOLYHL.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

GPOLYHU.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

WAS.description: Write CRC Data Register As Seed

FXOR.description: Complement Read Of CRC Data Register

BC12.description: BC1.2 compatibility. This bit cannot be changed after start detection.

CLOCK_UNIT.description: Unit of Measurement Encoding for Clock Speed

CLOCK_SPEED.description: Numerical Value of Clock Speed in Binary

TDCD_DBNC.description: Time Period to Debounce D+ Signal

CHECK_DM.description: Time Before Check of D- Line

TVDPSRC_CON.description: Time Period Before Enabling D+ Pullup

TVDMSRC_ON.description: Sets the amount of time (in ms) that the module enables the VDM_SRC. Valid values are 0-40ms.

TWAIT_AFTER_PRD.description: Sets the amount of time (in ms) that the module waits after primary detection before start to secondary detection

DACINTC%s.description: DAC Interval Trigger n Control register

BB0.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB1.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB2.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB3.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB4.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB5.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB6.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

BB7.description: PDB Channel Pre-Trigger Back-to-Back Operation Enable

COUNT.description: Counter Value

INIT.description: Initial Value Of The FTM Counter

REINIT.description: FTM Counter Reinitialization By Synchronization (FTM counter synchronization)

DECAPEN0.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Enable For n = 0

DECAP0.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Captures For n = 0

DECAPEN1.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Enable For n = 2

DECAP1.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Captures For n = 2

DECAPEN2.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Enable For n = 4

DECAP2.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Captures For n = 4

DECAPEN3.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Enable For n = 6

DECAP3.description: Dual Edge Capture Mode Captures For n = 6

TOFDIR.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

QUADIR.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

SWRSTCNT.description: FTM counter synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

SWWRBUF.description: MOD, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

SWOM.description: Output mask synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

SWINVC.description: Inverting control synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

SWSOC.description: Software output control synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

HWRSTCNT.description: FTM counter synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWWRBUF.description: MOD, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWOM.description: Output mask synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWINVC.description: Inverting control synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWSOC.description: Software output control synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

SWSOC.description: Software output control synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

HWRSTCNT.description: FTM counter synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWWRBUF.description: MOD, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWOM.description: Output mask synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWINVC.description: Inverting control synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

HWSOC.description: Software output control synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

CLPD.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLPS.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP4.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP3.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP2.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP1.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLP0.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLMD.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLMS.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM4.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM3.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM2.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM1.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

CLM0.description: ADC Minus-Side General Calibration Value Register

GENCS.description: TSI General Control and Status Register

EOSDMEO.description: End-of-Scan DMA Transfer Request Enable Only

MODE.description: TSI analog modes setup and status bits.

USBVSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during VLPR and VLPW modes

USBSSTBY.description: USB voltage regulator in standby mode during Stop, VLPS, LLS and VLLS modes.

URWE.description: USB voltage regulator enable write enable

UVSWE.description: USB voltage regulator VLP standby write enable

USSWE.description: USB voltage regulator stop standby write enable

USBVREGSEL.description: Selects the default input voltage source to the USB Regulator in case both VREG_IN0 and VREG_IN1 are powered

USBVREGPD.description: Enables the pulldown on the output of the USB Regulator.

FTM1CH0SRC.description: FTM1 channel 0 input capture source select

FTM2CH0SRC.description: FTM2 channel 0 input capture source select

FTM2CH1SRC.description: FTM2 channel 1 input capture source select

TPM1CH0SRC.description: TPM1 channel 0 input capture source select

TPM2CH0SRC.description: TPM2 channel 0 input capture source select

STCTRLH.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register High

STCTRLL.description: Watchdog Status and Control Register Low

WDOGEN.description: Enables or disables the WDOG's operation

CLKSRC.description: Selects clock source for the WDOG timer and other internal timing operations.

IRQRSTEN.description: Used to enable the debug breadcrumbs feature

ALLOWUPDATE.description: Enables updates to watchdog write-once registers, after the reset-triggered initial configuration window (WCT) closes, through unlock sequence

DBGEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Debug mode.

STOPEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Stop mode.

WAITEN.description: Enables or disables WDOG in Wait mode.

TESTWDOG.description: Puts the watchdog in the functional test mode

TESTSEL.description: Effective only if TESTWDOG is set. Selects the test to be run on the watchdog timer.

BYTESEL.description: This 2-bit field selects the byte to be tested when the watchdog is in the byte test mode.

DISTESTWDOG.description: Allows the WDOG's functional test mode to be disabled permanently

TOVALHIGH.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

TOVALLOW.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit time-out value for the watchdog timer

WINHIGH.description: Defines the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

WINLOW.description: Defines the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit window for the windowed mode of operation of the watchdog

WDOGUNLOCK.description: Writing the unlock sequence values to this register to makes the watchdog write-once registers writable again

TIMEROUTHIGH.description: Shows the value of the upper 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

TIMEROUTLOW.description: Shows the value of the lower 16 bits of the watchdog timer.

RSTCNT.description: Counts the number of times the watchdog resets the system

PRESCVAL.description: 3-bit prescaler for the watchdog clock source

SERVICE.description: The EWM service mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

COMPAREL.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum service time is required

COMPAREH.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum service time is required

CGH1.description: CMT Carrier Generator High Data Register 1

CGL1.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 1

CGH2.description: CMT Carrier Generator High Data Register 2

CGL2.description: CMT Carrier Generator Low Data Register 2

MSC.description: CMT Modulator Status and Control Register

CMD1.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Mark High

CMD2.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Mark Low

CMD3.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Space High

CMD4.description: CMT Modulator Data Register Space Low

PH.description: Primary Carrier High Time Data Value

PL.description: Primary Carrier Low Time Data Value

SH.description: Secondary Carrier High Time Data Value

SL.description: Secondary Carrier Low Time Data Value

ATCVH.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value High Register

ATCVL.description: MCG Auto Trim Compare Value Low Register

FCFTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

SCTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

SCFTRIM.description: Slow Internal Reference Clock Fine Trim

FCTRIM.description: Fast Internal Reference Clock Trim Setting

DMX32.description: DCO Maximum Frequency with 32.768 kHz Reference

LOLRE.description: PLL Loss of Lock Reset Enable

EXT_PLL_LOCS.description: External PLL Loss of Clock Status

PLL_LOCRE.description: MCG External PLL Loss of Clock Reset Enable

PLL_CME.description: MCG External PLL Clock Monitor Enable

FLT.description: I2C Programmable Input Glitch Filter Register

SMB.description: I2C SMBus Control and Status register

SLTH.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register High

SLTL.description: I2C SCL Low Timeout Register Low

SSIE.description: I2C Bus Stop or Start Interrupt Enable

AP7816A_T0.description: UART 7816 ATR Duration Timer Register A

AP7816B_T0.description: UART 7816 ATR Duration Timer Register B

WGP7816_T1.description: UART 7816 Wait and Guard Parameter Register

RXEDGIE.description: RxD Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

RIE.description: Receiver Full Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable

TIE.description: Transmitter Interrupt or DMA Transfer Enable.

RXEDGIF.description: RxD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

TXDIR.description: Transmitter Pin Data Direction in Single-Wire mode

RT.description: Reads return the contents of the read-only receive data register and writes go to the write-only transmit data register

PARITYE.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with a parity error.

NOISY.description: The current received dataword contained in D and C3[R8] was received with noise.

CHOPEN.description: Chop oscillator enable. When set, internal chopping operation is enabled and the internal analog offset will be minimized.

LVDSC1.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 1 register

LVDSC2.description: Low Voltage Detect Status And Control 2 register

RSTFLTSRW.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

RSTFLTSS.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

RSTFLTSEL.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

SSACKERR.description: Sticky Stop Mode Acknowledge Error Reset

WECINT.description: Wakeup Event Enable On Card Interrupt

WECINS.description: Wakeup Event Enable On SD Card Insertion

WECRM.description: Wakeup Event Enable On SD Card Removal

CEBESEN.description: Command End Bit Error Status Enable

DEBESEN.description: Data End Bit Error Status Enable

CEBEIEN.description: Command End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

DEBEIEN.description: Data End Bit Error Interrupt Enable

CNIBAC12E.description: Command Not Issued By Auto CMD12 Error

AC12NE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Not Executed

AC12TOE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Time Out Error

AC12CE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 CRC Error

AC12EBE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 End Bit Error

AC12IE.description: Force Event Auto Command 12 Index Error

CNIBAC12E.description: Force Event Command Not Executed By Auto Command 12 Error

CTOE.description: Force Event Command Time Out Error

CEBE.description: Force Event Command End Bit Error

DTOE.description: Force Event Data Time Out Error

DEBE.description: Force Event Data End Bit Error

ADMAES.description: ADMA Error State (When ADMA Error Is Occurred.)

EXBLKNU.description: Exact Block Number Block Read Enable For SDIO CMD53

DTOCVACK.description: Boot ACK Time Out Counter Value

AUTOSABGEN.description: When boot, enable auto stop at block gap function

BOOTBLKCNT.description: Defines the stop at block gap value of automatic mode

TDSR.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring Start Register

RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN.description: Tx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

RMON_T_UNDERSIZE.description: Tx Packets Less Than Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

RMON_T_OVERSIZE.description: Tx Packets GT MAX_FL bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

RMON_T_FRAG.description: Tx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

RMON_T_JAB.description: Tx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

RMON_T_P_GTE2048.description: Tx Packets Greater Than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

IEEE_T_1COL.description: Frames Transmitted with Single Collision Statistic Register

IEEE_T_MCOL.description: Frames Transmitted with Multiple Collisions Statistic Register

IEEE_T_DEF.description: Frames Transmitted after Deferral Delay Statistic Register

IEEE_T_LCOL.description: Frames Transmitted with Late Collision Statistic Register

IEEE_T_EXCOL.description: Frames Transmitted with Excessive Collisions Statistic Register

IEEE_T_MACERR.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun Statistic Register

IEEE_T_CSERR.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error Statistic Register

IEEE_T_FDXFC.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Transmitted Statistic Register

IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK.description: Octet Count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error Statistic Register

RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN.description: Rx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

RMON_R_UNDERSIZE.description: Rx Packets with Less Than 64 Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

RMON_R_OVERSIZE.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL and Good CRC Statistic Register

RMON_R_FRAG.description: Rx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

RMON_R_JAB.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

RMON_R_P_GTE2048.description: Rx Packets Greater than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

IEEE_R_DROP.description: Frames not Counted Correctly Statistic Register

IEEE_R_CRC.description: Frames Received with CRC Error Statistic Register

IEEE_R_ALIGN.description: Frames Received with Alignment Error Statistic Register

IEEE_R_MACERR.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Count Statistic Register

IEEE_R_FDXFC.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Received Statistic Register

IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK.description: Octet Count for Frames Received without Error Statistic Register

PADEN.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

ADDSEL.description: Source MAC Address Select On Transmit

CRCFWD.description: Forward Frame From Application With CRC

PADDR2.description: Bytes 4 (bits 31:24) and 5 (bits 23:16) of the 6-byte individual address used for exact match, and the source address field in PAUSE frames

IADDR1.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address

IADDR2.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address

GADDR1.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address

GADDR2.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address

R_DES_START.description: Pointer to the beginning of the receive buffer descriptor queue.

X_DES_START.description: Pointer to the beginning of the transmit buffer descriptor queue.

RX_SECTION_FULL.description: Value Of Receive FIFO Section Full Threshold

RX_SECTION_EMPTY.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Section Empty Threshold

STAT_SECTION_EMPTY.description: RX Status FIFO Section Empty Threshold

RX_ALMOST_EMPTY.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

RX_ALMOST_FULL.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Full Threshold

TX_SECTION_EMPTY.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Section Empty Threshold

TX_ALMOST_EMPTY.description: Value of Transmit FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

TX_ALMOST_FULL.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Almost Full Threshold

IPCHK.description: Enables insertion of IP header checksum.

PADREM.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

IPDIS.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

PRODIS.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

LINEDIS.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

TXPKTS.description: Number of transmit packets less than 64 bytes with good CRC
Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes with good CRC
Number of packets less than 64 bytes with bad CRC
Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes and bad CRC
Number of transmit packets greater than 2048 bytes

COUNT.description: Number of frames transmitted OK
Number of frames transmitted with one collision
Number of frames transmitted with multiple collisions
Number of frames transmitted with deferral delay
Number of frames transmitted with late collision
Number of frames transmitted with excessive collisions
Number of frames transmitted with transmit FIFO underrun
Number of frames transmitted with carrier sense error
Number of frames transmitted with SQE error
Number of flow-control pause frames transmitted
Octet count for frames transmitted without error Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields).
Number of packets received
Number of receive broadcast packets
Number of receive multicast packets
Number of receive packets with CRC or align error
Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and good CRC
Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and good CRC
Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and bad CRC
Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and bad CRC
Number of 64-byte receive packets
Number of 65- to 127-byte recieve packets
Number of 128- to 255-byte recieve packets
Number of 256- to 511-byte recieve packets
Number of 512- to 1023-byte recieve packets
Number of 1024- to 2047-byte recieve packets
Number of greater-than-2048-byte recieve packets
Number of receive octets
Frame count
Number of frames received OK
Number of frames received with CRC error
Number of frames received with alignment error
Receive FIFO overflow count
Number of flow-control pause frames received
Number of octets for frames received without error

PINPER.description: Enables event signal output assertion on period event

OFFSET.description: Offset value for one-shot event generation

INC.description: Clock Period Of The Timestamping Clock (ts_clk) In Nanoseconds

TIMESTAMP.description: Timestamp of the last frame transmitted by the core that had TxBD[TS] set

TF0.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 0

TF1.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 1

TF2.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 2

TF3.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 3

DACBFRPBF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

DACBFRPTF.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

DACBBIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

DACBTIEN.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

AIRCR.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

SHCSR.description: System Handler Control and State Register

DISDEFWBUF.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

VECTPENDING.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

PRIGROUP.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

USERSETMPEND.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

DIV_0_TRP.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BFHFNMIGN.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

STKALIGN.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

PRI_15.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

AUXFAULT.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

USER.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

THREAD.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

HFRDY.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

MMRDY.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BFRDY.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

MONRDY.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

LSPEN.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

ASPEN.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

ADDRESS.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

RMode.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

FZ.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

DN.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

AHP.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

RELOAD.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

CURRENT.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

TENMS.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

INTID.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

ASC.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

AMC.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
